explanation: Reasoning: The MISRA rule concerns the well-formedness of any for-loop in the target function and the behaviour of any functions called from within such a for-loop. The target function OS_GetLocalTime_Impl contains no for-loop itself, so the only way it could be implicated is via code in a callee that contains a for-loop. The only direct callee is OS_TimeAssembleFromNanoseconds, so its definition (and any symbols it in turn calls) must be inspected to determine if any for-loops there violate the rule. The static call graph shows OS_TimeAssembleFromNanoseconds has no further callees, so no additional symbols are required unless that function's body references other functions/types — those would be added only if seen in its definition.
